text: {{Infobox election | election_name = 2020 United States House of Representatives elections | country = United States | flag_year = 1960 | type = legislative | ongoing = No | previous_election = 2018 United States House of Representatives elections | previous_year = 2018 | election_date = November 3, 2020 | next_election = 2022 United States House of Representatives elections | next_year = 2022 | seats_for_election = All 435 seats in the United States House of Representatives | majority_seats = 218 | turnout = | image_size = x180px | party1 = Democratic Party (US) | image1 = Official photo of Speaker Nancy Pelosi in 2019.jpg | leader1 = Nancy Pelosi | leader_since1 = January 3, 2003 | leaders_seat1 = | last_election1 = 235 seats, 53.4% | seats_before1 = 232 | seats_needed1 = | seats1 = 222 | seat_change1 = 10 | party2 = Republican Party (US) | image2 = Kevin McCarthy, official photo, 116th Congress (cropped).jpg | leader2 = Kevin McCarthy | leader_since2 = January 3, 2019 | leaders_seat2 = | last_election2 = 199 seats, 44.8% | seats_before2 = 197 | seats_needed2 = 21 | seats2 = 212 | seat_change2 = 15 | map_image = 2020 US House Election Results.svg | map_size = 320px | map_alt = | map_caption = Results of the elections: | title = Speaker | before_election = Nancy Pelosi | before_party = Democratic Party (US) | after_election = Nancy Pelosi | after_party = Democratic Party (US) }} An election was held on November 3, 2020 to elect all 435 members of the United States House of Representatives. Six non-voting delegates were also elected from Washington, D.C. and U.S. territories. The Democratic Party had control of the house before the election. The results of the election were the Democrats still controlled the House of Representatives but their majority became very small. ==Notes== ==References== Category:2020 elections in the United States Category:United States House of Representatives elections Category:November 2020 events
title: 2020 United States House of Representatives elections
